meanings.definition: A variable or data type in computer programming.
meanings.sent1: In my code, I used different vars to store numbers and text.
meanings.sent2: Programmers often use vars to store information and manipulate it.
meanings.sent3: The vars in the program decided to throw a party and invite the functions.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a complex web of interconnected vars, each holding a piece of information.
meanings.sent5: The vars in the program danced around, changing values and creating magic.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'var', meaning a unit of electrical power in a circuit.
meanings.sent1: The circuit required several vars to ensure a steady flow of electricity.
meanings.sent2: Electricians measure power in vars to maintain safety in circuits.
meanings.sent3: The vars in the electrical system decided to have a race to see who could power up first.
meanings.sent4: The vars of electricity hummed like a choir, harmonizing to keep the lights on.
meanings.sent5: The vars in the circuit glowed brightly, illuminating the room with their power.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'var', meaning a unit of reactive power in an electrical system.
meanings.sent1: Engineers calculate vars to manage the reactive power in the system.
meanings.sent2: The vars in the electrical grid help balance the reactive power flow.
meanings.sent3: The vars in the power system decided to play hide and seek with the watts.
meanings.sent4: The vars of reactive power acted like silent guardians, stabilizing the electrical network.
meanings.sent5: The vars in the system pulsed with energy, ready to counter any power fluctuations.
